codeDescription: A simple React component example showing how to implement the Excalidraw drawing interface with minimal configuration. The component is rendered within a container with a fixed height.

codeTitle: Importing Excalidraw in a Bundler Environment
codeDescription: Demonstrates how to import Excalidraw components, styles, and types when using a bundler like Vite or Next.js. Shows proper import syntax for the ESM format.

codeTitle: Importing Excalidraw as ES6 Module with Webpack
codeDescription: Basic example of importing the Excalidraw component in a module bundler environment like Webpack using ES6 import syntax.

codeTitle: Implementing Custom Sidebar with Tabs in Excalidraw
codeDescription: A complete example demonstrating how to implement a custom sidebar with multiple tabs in Excalidraw. The example shows how to create a dockable sidebar with two tabs, custom styling, and a toggle button in the footer.

codeTitle: HTML Setup for Browser Integration of Excalidraw
codeDescription: HTML structure for directly integrating Excalidraw in a browser environment. Uses import maps to handle React dependencies and includes necessary stylesheet links and asset path configuration.

codeList.code: Excalidraw Embed Example

codeTitle: Displaying Excalidraw Asset Path Structure in ESM Format
codeDescription: Illustrates the new directory structure of the Excalidraw package after migration from UMD to ESM bundle format. Shows the organization of distribution files including development and production builds.

codeList.code:
@excalidraw/excalidraw/
├── dist/
│   ├── dev/
│   │   ├── fonts/
│   │   ├── index.css
│   │   ├── index.js
│   │   ├── index.js.map
│   ├── prod/
│   │   ├── fonts/
│   │   ├── index.css
│   │   ├── index.js
│   └── types/

codeDescription: Basic setup to initialize and store the Excalidraw API reference using React useState hook. The API reference is stored through the excalidrawAPI callback prop.

codeTitle: Complete Custom Theme Implementation for Excalidraw
codeDescription: Provides a comprehensive example of customizing all primary color variables for both light and dark themes, including darker, darkest, and light variations.

codeTitle: Using @excalidraw/mermaid-to-excalidraw to convert Mermaid to Excalidraw
codeDescription: Example code snippet demonstrating how to use the @excalidraw/mermaid-to-excalidraw library to parse Mermaid diagrams and convert them to Excalidraw elements. It includes error handling and uses the convertToExcalidrawElements function.

codeTitle: Dynamic Import of Excalidraw Wrapper in Next.js Pages Router
codeDescription: Implementation for Next.js Pages Router that dynamically imports the Excalidraw wrapper component with SSR disabled to ensure the component is only rendered on the client side.

codeTitle: JavaScript Setup for Browser Integration of Excalidraw
codeDescription: JavaScript implementation for direct browser integration of Excalidraw. Creates a React component with Excalidraw and renders it into a DOM element using ES modules with external React dependencies.
Example of props configuration including initialData as a function returning ExcalidrawInitialDataState and custom theme handling with system theme support.

codeTitle: Dynamic Import of Excalidraw in Next.js
codeDescription: Implementation using Next.js dynamic import to load the Excalidraw component only on the client side, since it doesn't support server-side rendering. This approach works specifically for importing the named Excalidraw component.

codeTitle: Creating Connected Elements with IDs in Excalidraw using JavaScript
codeDescription: This example demonstrates how to create and connect multiple elements in Excalidraw by using unique IDs. It shows how to bind arrows to existing shapes by referencing their IDs in the start and end properties, allowing for complex diagram creation.

codeTitle: MainMenu with Default Items in Excalidraw (JSX)
codeDescription: Example of combining Excalidraw's built-in default menu items with custom items. This code shows how to use pre-made components like Socials and Export alongside custom menu entries.

codeList.code:
function App() { return (
window.alert("Item1")}> Item1 window.alert("Item2")}> Item 2
); }

codeTitle: Installing Excalidraw Component with Package Managers
codeDescription: Commands to install the Excalidraw component using npm or yarn. Requires React and ReactDOM as dependencies.

codeList.code:
npm install react react-dom @excalidraw/excalidraw
# or
yarn add react react-dom @excalidraw/excalidraw

codeTitle: Migrating from commitToHistory to captureUpdate in updateScene API
codeDescription: Shows how to migrate from the deprecated commitToHistory parameter to the new captureUpdate parameter in the updateScene API. This change is part of the multiplayer undo/redo functionality implementation.

codeTitle: Updating Excalidraw Scene with Custom Elements
codeDescription: Example showing how to update the Excalidraw scene with custom elements and app state. Demonstrates using the updateScene API to modify the canvas content.
Demonstrates how to customize the center section of the welcome screen with custom logo, heading, and menu items including external links and help dialog.

codeList.code:
function App() { return (
Welcome Screen Heading! Excalidraw GitHub
); }

codeDescription: Callback signature that appears to be for handling export operations. It provides access to the elements to be exported, the current application state, and the HTML canvas element of the scene.
Example demonstrating how to update the Excalidraw library with custom items. Shows usage of updateLibrary API with various configuration options.
Commands to install Excalidraw and its required dependencies using npm or yarn package managers.
pageTitle: Installation Guide for Excalidraw React Component

codeList.code:
npm install react react-dom @excalidraw/excalidraw
# or
yarn add react react-dom @excalidraw/excalidraw

codeTitle: Configuring Initial Data with scrollToCenter Property
codeDescription: Setting the scrollToCenter property in initialData allows hosts to control whether the view scrolls to center on component mount.

codeTitle: Basic MainMenu Usage with Custom Items in Excalidraw (JSX)
codeDescription: Example of customizing Excalidraw's MainMenu component with basic menu items. This snippet demonstrates how to create a main menu with clickable items that trigger alerts when selected.

codeTitle: MainMenu with Grouped Items in Excalidraw (JSX)
codeDescription: Example of using MainMenu.Group to organize menu items into logical sections with titles. This code demonstrates how to create structured menus with both default and custom items grouped under descriptive headers.

codeList.code:
function App() { return (
window.alert("Item1")}> Item1 window.alert("Item2")}> Item 2
); }

codeTitle: Handling Keyboard Events Globally in Excalidraw
codeDescription: Using the handleKeyboardGlobally prop to bind keyboard events to the document instead of the Excalidraw component. This prop was added in version 0.7.0.
Implementation of the onPointerUpdate callback which is triggered when the mouse pointer position changes. It provides coordinates, button state, and a map of all active pointers on the scene.
Example of using the renderTopRightUI prop to render custom UI in the top right corner of Excalidraw. This feature was added in version 0.8.0.
This example demonstrates how to use the UIOptions prop to customize canvas actions in Excalidraw. It disables the background color change, canvas clearing, and scene loading options.
Shows how to implement and customize the hints section of the welcome screen, including toolbar, menu, and help hints with custom content.

codeTitle: Creating Labelled Arrows with ExcalidrawElementSkeleton in JavaScript
codeDescription: This snippet demonstrates how to create labelled arrows using ExcalidrawElementSkeleton, including both basic and styled arrows.

codeTitle: Creating Lines and Arrows with ExcalidrawElementSkeleton in JavaScript
codeDescription: This snippet demonstrates how to create basic and styled lines and arrows using ExcalidrawElementSkeleton.

Example showing the basic structure of using Excalidraw with child components. The component accepts various UI components like MainMenu, WelcomeScreen, Sidebar, Footer, and LiveCollaborationTrigger as children.

codeList.code:
<Excalidraw>
  {/* Available child components:
    - MainMenu
    - WelcomeScreen
    - Sidebar
    - Footer
    - LiveCollaborationTrigger
  */}
</Excalidraw>

codeTitle: Creating Text Elements with ExcalidrawElementSkeleton in JavaScript
codeDescription: This example shows how to create text elements using ExcalidrawElementSkeleton, including both basic and styled text.

codeTitle: React Component Implementation with Custom Styles
codeDescription: Shows how to implement the Excalidraw component within a React application while applying custom styles using the custom-styles class.

A client-side wrapper component for Excalidraw that demonstrates importing the component along with utilities. This approach allows importing multiple exports from the Excalidraw package and using them together.
Using the initialData prop to load Excalidraw with existing library items. This feature was added in version 0.7.0.

codeTitle: Importing and Using convertToExcalidrawElements in JavaScript
codeDescription: This snippet demonstrates how to import and use the convertToExcalidrawElements function to create Excalidraw elements.
Using the serializeAsJSON helper function to save an Excalidraw scene to a file. This function was exposed in version 0.8.0.

This example demonstrates how to implement the LiveCollaborationTrigger component with Excalidraw. It shows how to manage collaborators, toggle collaboration state, and render the component using the renderTopRightUI prop. The snippet demonstrates adding/removing fake collaborators and handling the button click event.

codeTitle: Creating Arrow Bindings with ExcalidrawElementSkeleton in JavaScript
codeDescription: This example shows how to create arrow bindings to shapes and text elements using ExcalidrawElementSkeleton.
Shows how to use renderCustomStats prop to add custom statistics in the nerd stats dialog. The function returns JSX to be displayed in the stats panel.
Example of using the onLibraryChange prop to handle updates to the Excalidraw library. This prop was added in version 0.7.0 when library management became local to each Excalidraw instance.

codeList.code:
<Excalidraw
  onLibraryChange={(items) => {
    // Save library items to localStorage or your preferred storage
    localStorage.setItem('excalidrawLibrary', JSON.stringify(items));
  }}
/>

codeTitle: Loading Excalidraw with Initial Data in React
codeDescription: Example of using initialData to pre-populate an Excalidraw component with a rectangle element and custom app state. The example demonstrates setting custom elements, enabling zen mode, setting a background color, and enabling the scrollToContent feature.

codeTitle: Controlling Zen and Grid Modes via Props
codeDescription: Props for enabling zen mode and grid mode in Excalidraw. When these props are used, the respective modes are fully controlled by the host application.

codeTitle: Converting Mermaid to Excalidraw Elements using TypeScript
codeDescription: Example showing how to parse Mermaid syntax into Excalidraw elements using the parseMermaidToExcalidraw and convertToExcalidrawElements functions.

codeTitle: Using useDevice hook with mobile-specific UI rendering in Excalidraw
codeDescription: Example of creating a mobile-specific footer component using the useDevice hook to detect device type. The component renders a custom footer button only when the device is detected as mobile.

codeTitle: Subscribing to Pointer Down Events in Excalidraw
codeDescription: Subscribes to canvas pointerdown events, providing access to the active tool, pointer state, and event object. Returns an unsubscribe function.

codeList.code:
(
  callback: (
    activeTool: AppState["activeTool"],
    pointerDownState: PointerDownState,
    event: React.PointerEvent<HTMLElement>,
  ) => void,
) => () => void

codeTitle: Export JavaScript Utility Functions in Excalidraw
codeDescription: Exporting the changeProperty() and getFormValue() utility functions from the Excalidraw library, allowing developers to manipulate element properties and form values programmatically.

codeTitle: Setting Excalidraw Asset Path - Next.js Dynamic Configuration
codeDescription: Next.js implementation for dynamically setting the Excalidraw asset path based on location origin.
pageTitle: Installation Guide for Excalidraw React Component

codeList.code:
<Script id="load-env-variables" strategy="beforeInteractive" >
    { `window["EXCALIDRAW_ASSET_PATH"] = location.origin;` } // or use just "/"!
</Script>

codeTitle: Implementing Custom Footer in Excalidraw for Mobile Devices
codeDescription: This snippet shows how to implement a custom footer for mobile devices by combining the Footer component with MainMenu and using the useDevice hook to detect device type. The footer is conditionally rendered only on mobile devices inside the MainMenu component.

codeTitle: Creating a Frame with Children Elements in Excalidraw using TypeScript
codeDescription: This example shows how to create a frame that groups multiple Excalidraw elements together. The frame references child elements by their IDs in the children array and can include an optional name property to label the frame.

codeTitle: Setting Excalidraw Asset Path - Basic JavaScript
codeDescription: Basic JavaScript configuration to set the asset path for Excalidraw's resources.
pageTitle: Installation Guide for Excalidraw React Component

codeTitle: Implementing Excalidraw File Format Schema in JSON
codeDescription: Complete example of the Excalidraw file format schema showing structure for canvas elements, app state, and file data. Includes schema information, canvas elements array, editor state configuration, and image files data storage format.

codeTitle: Dynamic Import of Excalidraw Wrapper in Next.js App Router
codeDescription: Implementation for Next.js App Router that dynamically imports the Excalidraw wrapper component with SSR disabled, which follows the same pattern as in Pages Router but is used in the App Router context.

codeTitle: Importing and Using restoreAppState in JavaScript
codeDescription: Demonstrates how to import and use the restoreAppState function from the Excalidraw package. This function ensures all keys in the appState have appropriate values, setting default values for missing keys.

codeTitle: Subscribing to Change Events in Excalidraw
codeDescription: Subscribes to change events in Excalidraw, similar to the props.onChange functionality. Returns an unsubscribe function to remove the listener.

codeList.code:
(
  callback: (
    elements: readonly ExcalidrawElement[],
    appState: AppState,
    files: BinaryFiles,
  ) => void
) => () => void

codeTitle: Storing Custom Data on Excalidraw Elements with customData Object
codeDescription: Example of how to add custom data to an Excalidraw element using the customData property. This allows storing additional information that your application needs to track beyond the standard Excalidraw element attributes.

codeTitle: Importing and Using restoreElements in JavaScript
codeDescription: Shows how to import and use the restoreElements function from the Excalidraw package. This function ensures all properties of elements are correctly set, using default values for missing attributes.
Command to verify that all code follows the project's formatting standards using Prettier.

codeTitle: Exporting Excalidraw Diagram to Blob in JavaScript
codeDescription: Function to export an Excalidraw diagram definition to a Blob object, which can be used for file-like operations in the browser.
Sets the specified tool as the active tool in Excalidraw. Supports standard tools and custom tool types, with options for locking the selected tool.
Scrolls to center specified elements in the viewport with options for fitting content, animation, and duration.
Example of importing serializeLibraryAsJSON function to convert library items to JSON string.
Command to install the @excalidraw/mermaid-to-excalidraw library using npm package manager.

codeTitle: Importing Excalidraw in Browser without Bundler
codeDescription: Shows how to use Excalidraw directly in a browser environment without a bundler, using import maps to deduplicate React dependencies and loading the library from ESM CDN.

codeList.code:
<!-- Environment: browser with a script tag and no bundler -->

<!-- excalidraw styles -->
<link
  rel="stylesheet"
  href="https://esm.sh/@excalidraw/excalidraw@0.18.0/dist/dev/index.css"
/>
<!-- import maps used for deduplicating react & react-dom versions -->
<script type="importmap">
  {
    "imports": {
      "react": "https://esm.sh/react@19.0.0",
      "react/jsx-runtime": "https://esm.sh/react@19.0.0/jsx-runtime",
      "react-dom": "https://esm.sh/react-dom@19.0.0"
    }
  }
</script>
<script type="module">
  import React from "https://esm.sh/react@19.0.0";
  import ReactDOM from "https://esm.sh/react-dom@19.0.0";
  import * as ExcalidrawLib from "https://esm.sh/@excalidraw/excalidraw@0.18.0/dist/dev/index.js?external=react,react-dom";
</script>

codeDescription: Basic import statement for the exportToBlob utility function.
The renderFooter prop enables host applications to provide custom footer content for Excalidraw, which is useful for implementing language pickers or other controls.
Updates the offsets for the Excalidraw component to ensure coordinates are computed correctly, especially after position changes not triggered by page scroll or container resize.
Example of importing the isElementInsideBBox utility, which checks if a single element is inside a specified bounding box.
Command to install the @excalidraw/element package using npm package manager.
Example of importing getNonDeletedElements function to filter out deleted elements from an array.

codeTitle: Creating Decorated Shapes with ExcalidrawElementSkeleton in JavaScript
codeDescription: This snippet demonstrates how to create decorated shapes (rectangle, ellipse, diamond) with additional properties using ExcalidrawElementSkeleton.

codeList.code:
convertToExcalidrawElements([
  {
    type: "rectangle",
    x: 50,
    y: 250,
    width: 200,
    height: 100,
    backgroundColor: "#c0eb75",
    strokeWidth: 2,
  },
  {
    type: "ellipse",
    x: 300,
    y: 250,
    width: 200,
    height: 100,
    backgroundColor: "#ffc9c9",
    strokeStyle: "dotted",
    fillStyle: "solid",
    strokeWidth: 2,
  },
  {
    type: "diamond",
    x: 550,
    y: 250,
    width: 200,
    height: 100,
    backgroundColor: "#a5d8ff",
    strokeColor: "#1971c2",
    strokeStyle: "dashed",
    fillStyle: "cross-hatch",
    strokeWidth: 2,
  },
]);

codeDescription: Displays a toast notification with a custom message. Options include making it closable and setting the duration before auto-dismissal.
Example of importing isLinearElement function to check if an element is of linear type (arrow or line).

codeTitle: Starting the Playground Server for Development
codeDescription: Command to start the local playground server for development and testing. The server runs on port 1234 and automatically opens in the browser.
pageTitle: Adding a New Diagram Type to Mermaid-to-Excalidraw

codeTitle: Example React Component Using Export to Canvas
codeDescription: Complete example of a React component that implements canvas export functionality with custom text rendering.
Example of importing loadLibraryFromBlob function to load library data from a blob.

codeTitle: Using useI18n hook for translations in Excalidraw components
codeDescription: Example of using the useI18n hook to translate strings in a custom component rendered within the Excalidraw editor. This demonstrates accessing the translation function and applying it to button text.

codeTitle: Loading Scene or Library from Blob
codeDescription: Example showing how to load either scene or library data from a blob and handle the response accordingly.

codeTitle: Creating Basic Shapes with ExcalidrawElementSkeleton in JSX
codeDescription: This example shows how to create basic shapes (rectangle, ellipse, diamond) using ExcalidrawElementSkeleton and render them in an Excalidraw component.

codeTitle: Setting Git Remote for Excalidraw Contributions in Bash
codeDescription: A series of Git commands to configure your local repository for contributing to Excalidraw. These commands set up the upstream remote, fetch the latest code, and configure the master branch to track the upstream repository.

codeList.code:
git remote add upstream https://github.com/excalidraw/excalidraw.git
git fetch upstream
git branch --set-upstream-to=upstream/master master

codeTitle: Basic CSS Variable Override for Excalidraw Themes
codeDescription: Demonstrates how to override primary color variables for both light and dark themes in Excalidraw using CSS selectors with proper specificity.
Using the onPaste prop to handle custom clipboard behaviors in Excalidraw. This prop was added in version 0.7.0.

codeList.code:
<Excalidraw
  onPaste={(data, event) => {
    // Custom paste handling logic
  }}
/>

codeDescription: Exported utility functions for restoring Excalidraw data: restore, restoreAppState, and restoreElements. These functions can be used by host applications to manage Excalidraw state.

codeTitle: Processed Edge Data with Position Information
codeDescription: The output from the parseEdge function that adds coordinate information for the connection endpoints and reflection points, computed from the SVG. This enables accurate arrow rendering in Excalidraw.
pageTitle: Flowchart Parser for Mermaid to Excalidraw Conversion

codeDescription: Reference to the validateEmbeddable prop used to customize validation of embeddable source URLs in Excalidraw. Used for ensuring security of embedded content.

Signature for the onChange callback that gets triggered whenever the Excalidraw component updates. It provides access to the elements in the scene, the current application state, and any binary files added to the scene.

codeTitle: Processed Subgraph Data with Position Information
codeDescription: The output from the parseSubgraph function that adds position, dimension, and simplified node ID information. This data is used to create group elements in Excalidraw that contain the specified nodes.
pageTitle: Flowchart Parser for Mermaid to Excalidraw Conversion

codeDescription: The exportToBackend prop allows host applications to implement shareable links by handling the export process to a backend service.
The getAppState method is exposed on excalidrawRef, allowing host applications to access the current state of the Excalidraw component.
The raw output from the getVertices API showing node data without position information. This data includes identifiers, text content, and styling information for the flowchart nodes.
pageTitle: Flowchart Parser for Mermaid to Excalidraw Conversion

gitGraph
  commit
  commit
  branch develop
  checkout develop
  commit
  commit
  checkout main
  merge develop
  commit
  commit

Provides access to the history API which allows clearing the undo/redo history.
Command to install the mermaid-to-excalidraw package using Yarn package manager.

codeTitle: Cloning the Excalidraw Repository with Git
codeDescription: Command to clone the Excalidraw repository from GitHub to your local machine to start development.
Resets the scene, clearing all elements. If resetLoadingState is set to true, it will also forcibly set the loading state to false.

codeDescription: Command to update test snapshots after making changes that affect component rendering or behavior.
Command to install all necessary dependencies before starting development on the @excalidraw/excalidraw package.
Using the scrollToContent API to scroll to specific elements or all elements in the Excalidraw scene. This API was updated in version 0.7.0.

Configuration of sidebar state properties in Excalidraw. The appState.defaultSidebarDockedPreference property replaced the previous isSidebarDocked property with different semantics for the default sidebar.
Command to start a local development server for the Excalidraw website. This opens a browser window and reflects changes without requiring server restarts.

codeTitle: Importing and Using restore Function in JavaScript
codeDescription: Illustrates how to import and use the restore function from the Excalidraw package. This function combines restoreElements and restoreAppState to ensure both elements and state are set to appropriate values.
Command to run after the prerelease script to publish the package to npm as a production release.
API usage example for setting canvas offsets in Excalidraw. This API was renamed from 'setCanvasOffsets' to 'refresh' as part of a breaking change.
The viewModeEnabled prop enables view mode in Excalidraw. When using this prop, view mode is fully controlled by the host and will not appear in the context menu.
Command to install the mermaid-to-excalidraw package using NPM package manager.

codeTitle: Starting Next.js Development Server with Package Managers

npm run dev
# or
yarn dev
# or
pnpm dev
# or
bun dev

Command to generate static content for the Excalidraw website into the 'build' directory. The resulting files can be served using any static contents hosting service.

Simple Mermaid flowchart demonstrating circle shape usage.

codeDescription: Example showing how to use the useHandleLibrary hook to manage library imports and initialization.
Example of importing internationalization utilities from Excalidraw, including the default language code, list of supported languages, and the useI18n hook.

codeTitle: Setting Excalidraw Asset Path for Self-Hosting
codeDescription: Three different approaches for setting the EXCALIDRAW_ASSET_PATH global variable to enable self-hosting of Excalidraw font assets. This is necessary when not using the default CDN-loaded fonts.

codeList.code:
// Next.js
<Script id="load-env-variables" strategy="beforeInteractive">
  {`window["EXCALIDRAW_ASSET_PATH"] = location.origin;`} // or use just "/"!
</Script>

codeDescription: Example of importing the getCommonBounds utility, which is used to calculate the common bounding box coordinates for a set of Excalidraw elements.

codeTitle: Using the ExcalidrawAPI.scrollToContent API with Viewport Options

codeDescription: Global configuration variable that allows hosts to set a custom URL for loading Excalidraw assets. By default, assets are loaded from unpkg.com with the current version.

): readonly [

  minY: number,
  maxX: number,
  maxY: number,
]

codeDescription: Function type definition for getDimensions that returns width, height and optional scale for canvas export.

codeTitle: Demonstrating Frame Ordering in JSON for Excalidraw
codeDescription: This JSON snippet illustrates the correct ordering of frame elements and their children in an Excalidraw project. Frame children should be listed first, followed by the frame element itself. This ordering is crucial for proper rendering, clipping, and performance optimizations.

codeList.code:
[
  other_element,
  frame1_child1,
  frame1_child2,
  frame1,
  other_element,
  frame2_child1,
  frame2_child2,
  frame2,
  other_element,
  ...
]

codeDescription: Example showing how to handle link opening in Excalidraw, including routing internal links through app router and external links to new tabs. Uses React useCallback and useHistory hooks.

codeTitle: Preparing for a Production Release of @excalidraw/excalidraw
codeDescription: Command to run the prerelease script that updates package.json, changelog, and other necessary files before creating a production release. You need to specify the version parameter.
Command to start the Excalidraw development server, which allows viewing and testing the application locally at http://localhost:3000.
Command to launch the example application that uses the @excalidraw/excalidraw package for development and testing purposes. This will open http://localhost:3001 in your default browser.

codeTitle: Triggering a Test Release via PR Comment
codeDescription: Command to post as a comment in a pull request to trigger a test release of the @excalidraw/excalidraw package using the excalibot.

codeTitle: MainMenu with Custom Item in Excalidraw (JSX)
codeDescription: Example of using MainMenu.ItemCustom to create fully customized menu items in Excalidraw. This snippet shows how to insert custom HTML elements like buttons into the menu structure.

codeTitle: Importing Excalidraw Utils in ES6 Module
codeDescription: Example of importing exportToSvg and exportToBlob functions from @excalidraw/utils package as ES6 modules.
Command to clone the mermaid-to-excalidraw repository from GitHub to local environment.
Shows how cross arrow heads fallback to bar arrow heads in Excalidraw.
Command to create a production build of the package, generating the dist folder for publishing.
Shows the basic implementation of the WelcomeScreen component within an Excalidraw container. This renders the default welcome screen with standard components.
Example showing how markdown text in Mermaid falls back to regular text in Excalidraw.
Command to publish the package to npm registry after updating package.json with new version.
Command to reformat all files in the Excalidraw project using Prettier for consistent code style.
Command to deploy the Excalidraw website using SSH authentication. This builds the website and pushes it to the deployment target.

codeTitle: Implementing Custom Footer in Excalidraw for Desktop
codeDescription: This snippet demonstrates how to create a custom footer in Excalidraw for desktop devices by wrapping your UI elements with the Footer component. It shows a simple implementation with a button that displays an alert when clicked.
Command to install all required dependencies for the Excalidraw project using Yarn package manager.

codeTitle: Deploying Excalidraw Website with GitHub Authentication
codeDescription: Command to deploy the Excalidraw website without SSH, using GitHub authentication instead. This builds the website and pushes to the 'gh-pages' branch.
Example of importing the elementPartiallyOverlapsWithOrContainsBBox utility, which checks if an element overlaps with or is contained within a bounding box.
Command to install the @excalidraw/utils package using npm package manager.

codeTitle: Configuring Vite Environment Variables for Excalidraw
codeDescription: Configuration snippet for Vite to define process.env.IS_PREACT environment variable, which is required for proper Excalidraw package functionality. This resolves the 'process is not defined' ReferenceError commonly encountered when using Vite as a build tool.
Example of importing isInvisiblySmallElement function to check if an element has zero dimensions.

codeTitle: Using Excalidraw Utils in Browser with CDN
codeDescription: HTML script tags to include and use Excalidraw Utils directly in a browser via CDN with global variable access.

codeList.code:
<script src="https://unpkg.com/@excalidraw/utils@0.1.0/dist/excalidraw-utils.min.js"></script>
<script>
  // ExcalidrawUtils is a global variable defined by excalidraw.min.js
  const { exportToSvg, exportToBlob } = ExcalidrawUtils;
</script>

codeDescription: Command to start the development playground server on port 1234.

codeTitle: Exporting Excalidraw Diagram with exportToBlob and exportToSvg
codeDescription: Full example demonstrating how to use exportToSvg and exportToBlob functions with an Excalidraw diagram object. Shows creating SVG output and generating a PNG blob URL.

Code example demonstrating how to import a library in Excalidraw using the API. This is referenced in the documentation when explaining the hashchange listener implementation requirement for host applications.
Command to install the @excalidraw/common package using npm package manager.
Command to install the @excalidraw/element package using PNPM package manager.
The raw output from the getEdges API showing connection data between nodes. This includes the connection type, styling, and endpoint node identifiers.
pageTitle: Flowchart Parser for Mermaid to Excalidraw Conversion

codeTitle: Setting Excalidraw Asset Path - HTML Script
codeDescription: HTML script configuration for setting Excalidraw's asset path when serving from a CDN.
pageTitle: Installation Guide for Excalidraw React Component

codeDescription: The userState property can be passed for collaborators to show their current state in the collaborative editing environment.
The raw output from the getSubgraphs API showing group data. This includes the group ID, title, and the nodes contained within the subgraph.
pageTitle: Flowchart Parser for Mermaid to Excalidraw Conversion

codeDescription: Vite configuration required when using Excalidraw with Preact, ensuring the IS_PREACT environment variable is properly defined to use the Preact-compatible build of Excalidraw.
Command to install the @excalidraw/element package using Yarn package manager.

codeTitle: Configuring Vite for Preact Support in Excalidraw (Extended)
codeDescription: Extended configuration for Vite to ensure process.env.IS_PREACT is accessible in the build.
The langCode prop allows controlling the UI language in Excalidraw. This replaces the previous language picker UI element.

codeTitle: Setting Vite Configuration for Excalidraw Locales
codeDescription: Example configuration for Vite to properly handle Excalidraw locales, which are now ES modules requiring ES2022 support for arbitrary module namespace identifier names.

codeTitle: Supporting TypeScript Array Spreading in UMD Build
codeDescription: Using Array.from when spreading over a set to ensure TypeScript transpiles correctly in the UMD build. This fix addresses compilation issues in the Excalidraw API.
Command to install the @excalidraw/math package using npm package manager.
Demonstration of FontAwesome icons in Mermaid which fallback to text in Excalidraw.

codeList.code:
flowchart TD
  B["fab:fa-twitter for peace"]
  B-->C[fa:fa-ban forbidden]
  B-->E(A fa:fa-camera-retro perhaps?)

codeDescription: Configuration for Excalidraw asset path allowing multiple base URL fallbacks.

codeTitle: MainMenu with Item Links in Excalidraw (JSX)
codeDescription: Example of using MainMenu.ItemLink to create clickable links within Excalidraw's main menu. This code demonstrates how to create menu items that link to external websites.

codeTitle: Configuring Web Crawler Access Rules in robots.txt for Excalidraw
codeDescription: This robots.txt file specifies crawling permissions for different user agents. Twitter and Facebook bots have unrestricted access, while other bots are limited to the homepage and sitemap.xml. The file also specifies the sitemap location.

codeList.code:
User-agent: Twitterbot
Disallow:

User-agent: facebookexternalhit
Disallow:

User-agent: *
Allow: /$
Allow: /
Allow: /sitemap.xml
Disallow: /

Sitemap: https://excalidraw.com/sitemap.xml

codeTitle: Disabling Image Tool in Excalidraw UI Options
codeDescription: Code snippet showing how to disable the image tool in Excalidraw's UI options.

codeTitle: Detecting Scroll Changes in Excalidraw Canvas
codeDescription: Signature for the onScrollChange callback that is triggered when the canvas is scrolled. It provides the new scroll position coordinates for both X and Y axes.

codeTitle: Custom Link Generation for Excalidraw Elements
codeDescription: Function signature for the generateLinkForSelection prop that allows customizing how links to elements or groups are generated. This enables the host application to take over the creation and handling of element links.

codeTitle: Adding Binary Files to Excalidraw AppState
codeDescription: Adds supplied files data to the appState.files cache, preserving existing files already in the cache.
Customizes the mouse cursor on the canvas by setting it to the specified cursor value.
Example of importing default language and supported languages from Excalidraw package.
Example of importing getFreeDrawSvgPath function to get SVG path data for free draw elements.
Example of importing getSceneVersion function to retrieve current scene version.
Example of importing the viewportCoordsToSceneCoords function, which converts viewport coordinates to scene coordinates.

codeTitle: Rendering Custom Top-Right UI in Excalidraw
codeDescription: Demonstrates how to use renderTopRightUI prop to add a custom button in the top right corner of Excalidraw. The function takes isMobile and appState parameters and returns JSX or null.
Example of importing the elementsOverlappingBBox utility, which filters elements that are inside, overlap, or contain a specified bounding box.
Basic import statement for the exportToCanvas utility function.

codeTitle: Frame Element Type Definition in Excalidraw using TypeScript
codeDescription: This snippet shows the TypeScript type definition for creating frame elements in Excalidraw. Frames require a type property set to 'frame' and a children array containing IDs of elements to be grouped within the frame.

codeTitle: Exporting Excalidraw Diagram to SVG in JavaScript
codeDescription: Function to export an Excalidraw diagram definition to an SVGElement, which can be used for vector graphics representation of the diagram.

codeTitle: Processed Vertex Data with Position Information
codeDescription: The output from the parseVertex function that enriches the node data with position and dimension information computed from the SVG. This data is ready to be converted to Excalidraw elements.
pageTitle: Flowchart Parser for Mermaid to Excalidraw Conversion

codeDescription: Example of a Mermaid flowchart using rectangles, circles, diamonds, and arrows with directional flow.

codeList.code:
flowchart TD
  A[Christmas] -->|Get money| B(Go shopping)
  B --> C{Let me think}
  C -->|One| D[Laptop]
  C -->|Two| E[iPhone]
  C -->|Three| F[Car]

codeDescription: Commands to build and run a Docker container for self-hosting Excalidraw. This creates an analytics-free instance running on port 5000.

codeList.code:
docker build -t excalidraw/excalidraw .
docker run --rm -dit --name excalidraw -p 5000:80 excalidraw/excalidraw:latest

codeTitle: Installing Excalidraw Website Dependencies using Yarn
codeDescription: Command to install all required dependencies for the Excalidraw website using Yarn package manager.
Toggles the sidebar visibility, with options to open a specific tab and force a specific state. Returns whether the sidebar was toggled on or off.

codeList.code: (opts: { name: string; tab?: string; force?: boolean }) => boolean;

codeDescription: Command to install the @excalidraw/mermaid-to-excalidraw library using yarn package manager.

codeTitle: Installing Excalidraw NPM Package with Package Manager
codeDescription: Instructions for installing the Excalidraw npm package using either npm or yarn. Requires React and ReactDOM as peer dependencies.
pageTitle: Excalidraw: Open Source Virtual Hand-Drawn Style Whiteboard

codeList.code:
npm install react react-dom @excalidraw/excalidraw
# or
yarn add react react-dom @excalidraw/excalidraw

codeDescription: Command to install the @excalidraw/utils package using Yarn package manager.
Command to install the @excalidraw/math package using Yarn package manager as an alternative to npm.
Resets the mouse cursor to the default cursor style for Excalidraw.
Command to install the @excalidraw/math package using PNPM package manager.
Command to install the @excalidraw/common package using Yarn package manager as an alternative to npm.
Command to install the @excalidraw/common package using PNPM package manager.
The onCollabButtonClick prop allows customizing the behavior when the collaboration button is clicked. If not provided, the collaboration button is hidden.

codeTitle: Configuring Vite for Preact Support in Excalidraw
codeDescription: Configuration snippet for Vite to enable Preact support in Excalidraw by setting the IS_PREACT environment variable.
